org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes

Class MTStencilPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      • org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.AbstractVisibleComponent
        • org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.AbstractShape
          • org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTCSSStylableShape
            • org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTPolygon
              • org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.shapes.MTStencilPolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CSSStylableComponent, IMTComponent, IMTComponent3D, IMTInputEventListener, IGestureEventListener

    public class MTStencilPolygon
extends MTPolygon
    This class can only be used with OpenGL!
    This class can be used to draw concave, non-simple polygons using the stencil buffer.
    Author:
    Christopher Ruff

        pApplet - the applet
        innerVertices - the vertices used for picking and other calculations, its best to use the biggest contour for this
        contours - the contour(s) of the shape

    • Method Detail

      • setVertices

        public void setVertices(Vertex[] vertices)
        NOTE: this also sets the contours to one and uses the new vertices as the only contour! If you want to set other countours use the setContours or setVerticesAndContours method!.
        Overrides:
        setVertices in class MTPolygon
        Parameters:
        vertices - the vertices

      • setNewContours

        public void setNewContours(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex[]> contours)
        Sets new outlines for this stencil polygon. This is a separate method, because when you want to ouline polygons with holes, you have to have separate, not connected outline arrays.
        Parameters:
        contours - the contours

      • drawComponent

        public void drawComponent(processing.core.PGraphics g)
        Description copied from class: MTComponent
        Executes this component's drawing commands (Not its children!). The component's matrix has to be made current before drawing.
        This method can be overridden in subclasses and filled with drawing commands.
        NOTE: This method is called by the application. Usually you should not invoke this method directly!
        Specified by:
        drawComponent in interface IMTComponent
        Overrides:
        drawComponent in class MTPolygon
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context

      • generateDisplayLists

        public void generateDisplayLists()
        Description copied from class: AbstractShape
        Generates 2 openGL display lists for drawing this shape.
        One for the interior (with textures etc.) and one for drawing the outline.
        setUseDirectGL has to be set to true first!
        To use the display lists for drawing, call setUseDisplayList() This method only generates them!
        NOTE: if the shape was using a display list before we should delete it before setting a new one!
        Overrides:
        generateDisplayLists in class AbstractShape

      • getContours

        public java.util.List<Vertex[]> getContours()
        returns the vertex arrays which shape the outline of the character.
        Returns:
        the contours
